input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The York Chiller PRVs to be replaced as advised by Zurich Insurance Inspector
scope_of_work.scope:
Isolate chiller to be worked on and carry out safety checks
Remove and replace the expired high side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer
Reverse dual port valve position and check for leaks on new valve threaded 
connection
Remove and replace the expired high side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer (4 No High side PRVs)
Remove and replace the expired low side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer
Reverse dual port valve position and check for leaks on new valve threaded 
connection
Remove and replace the expired low side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer (4 No Low side PRVs per chiller)
Hand over relevant certification / paperwork to site
Digital Service Report to be issued on completion of the work order
scope_of_work.justification: It is a safety requirement that the PRVs are replaced every 5 years
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: In the event of high pressure on the chiller it needs to be ensured that the safety valves activate to protect the equipment

input.associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (Yes), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

output.overview: Project 'UPM-York Chiller PRV Replacement' is located in United Kingdom at site Al Qadisiyah, managed by Qwerty for client Kyndryl. Prepared by Prof. Miracle Abshire under internal work order UK-EW-05052022-9143. Current status is 'Work Order Closed'.
output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: The York Chiller PRVs to be replaced as advised by Zurich Insurance Inspector. The defined scope of work includes: Isolate chiller to be worked on and carry out safety checks
Remove and replace the expired high side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer
Reverse dual port valve position and check for leaks on new valve threaded 
connection
Remove and replace the expired high side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer (4 No High side PRVs)
Remove and replace the expired low side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer
Reverse dual port valve position and check for leaks on new valve threaded 
connection
Remove and replace the expired low side PRV in closed position on the dual port 
manifold with new, using industry standard thread sealant and allowing curing time as 
recommended by the manufacturer (4 No Low side PRVs per chiller)
Hand over relevant certification / paperwork to site
Digital Service Report to be issued on completion of the work order. The justification provided is: It is a safety requirement that the PRVs are replaced every 5 years. If not approved, the effect would be: In the event of high pressure on the chiller it needs to be ensured that the safety valves activate to protect the equipment.
output.status_history: First, billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire. Then, offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire.
